author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.en: Linked Discourses 35
10. The Sixes
101. It’s Not Yours (1st)
“Mendicants, give up what’s not yours.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
And what isn’t yours?
The eye isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
Sights …

segments.pli: Te vo pahīnā hitāya sukhāya bhavissanti.

segments.en: Eye consciousness …

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.

segments.en: Eye contact …

segments.pli: So vo pahīno hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na tumhākaṃ.
segments.en: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
The ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: Sā vo pahīnā hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
Te vo pahīnā hitāya sukhāya bhavissanti.
Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
So vo pahīno hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
Yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na tumhākaṃ.
Taṃ pajahatha. Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati … pe ….

segments.en: The mind isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: So vo pahīno hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.
Thoughts …

segments.pli: Te vo pahīnā hitāya sukhāya bhavissanti.

segments.en: Mind consciousness …

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.

segments.en: Mind contact …

segments.pli: So vo pahīno hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na tumhākaṃ.
segments.en: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, yaṃ imasmiṃ jetavane tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ taṃ jano hareyya vā ḍaheyya vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kareyya,
segments.en: Suppose a person was to carry off the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in this Jeta’s Grove, or burn them, or do what they want with them.
Would you think:

segments.pli: ‘amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī’”ti?
segments.en: ‘This person is carrying us off, burning us, or doing what they want with us?’”
“No, sir.
Why is that?

segments.pli: “Na hi no etaṃ, bhante, attā vā attaniyaṃ vā”ti.
segments.en: Because that’s neither self nor belonging to self.”
“In the same way, the eye isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness. …

segments.pli: yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na tumhākaṃ.
segments.en: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissatī”ti.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.”

suttaplex.blurb: Let go of what is not yours: the process of sense experience. You wouldn’t be upset if someone took the grass and sticks from the monastery grounds, so why worry over the aggregates?
